input: observation 1: Tuesdays are laundry days at my apartment. [SEP] observation 2: All my clothes smell great. [SEP] hypothesis 1: I just washed all my clothes. [SEP] hypothesis 2: I just washed all my dirty dishes.

observation 1: Max had just brought his tree in for Christmas. [SEP] observation 2: He just tossed the tree bottom into the trash pile. [SEP] hypothesis 1: All of the needles turned brown and fell out. [SEP] hypothesis 2: All of the needles were a vibrant green.

observation 1: My son came inside screaming that he saw a wolf. [SEP] observation 2: They had a new siberian husky tied up in their yard. [SEP] hypothesis 1: i looked out the window and saw nobody. [SEP] hypothesis 2: I looked out the window and saw the neighbor's dog.

observation 1: John wanted pizza, but he was broke. [SEP] observation 2: John had carrots instead. [SEP] hypothesis 1: He had carrots in the fridge. [SEP] hypothesis 2: John did not even have carrots in the fridge.

observation 1: Brian and his wife just had a baby boy. [SEP] observation 2: His wife supported him with his decision. [SEP] hypothesis 1: Brian wanted the boy to himself. [SEP] hypothesis 2: Brian wanted the boy to have a sister.

observation 1: My dishwasher is broken. [SEP] observation 2: I force myself to wash them all. [SEP] hypothesis 1: Three days until it is fixed, all dishes are dirty. [SEP] hypothesis 2: Three days until it is fixed and luckily all my dishes were clean.

observation 1: Ana was only one year old, and she wore a tiny green swimsuit. [SEP] observation 2: Ana made sand shapes until it was time to leave, and she was happy. [SEP] hypothesis 1: Anna went to the movies with her parents. [SEP] hypothesis 2: Anna went to the beach with her parents.

observation 1: Bree wanted to give her friends candy for the holidays. [SEP] observation 2: Her friends told her they'd never tasted anything so delicious! [SEP] hypothesis 1: Bree spent a long time trying to make the bagels perfect. [SEP] hypothesis 2: Bree spent a long time trying to make the candy perfect.
